intro: Utricularia diflora, commonly known as the two-flowered bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is a small aquatic or semi-aquatic plant that typically grows in shallow water or damp soil. The plant is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like traps that capture and digest small aquatic organisms. Utricularia diflora has delicate, branched stems and small, often inconspicuous flowers that are usually pink or white. It is found in various parts of Asia and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor environments.
